docs.abstract: Pres Obama unveils recommendations by administration task force to change policing practices nationwide in wake of fatal police encounters of unarmed black men in Ferguson, Mo, and Staten Island by white officers.

docs.snippet: The push and the pushback show some of the challenges Mayor Bill de Blasio faces as he campaigns to eliminate traffic deaths....

docs.abstract: Safety advocates in New York City are calling for increased prosecution of drivers who violate traffic laws, especially in accidents in which a pedestrian is killed; also ask State Dept of Motor Vehicles to suspend driver’s license after serious offenses as deterrent to dangerous driving.

headline.main: Safety Advocates Want Harsher Penalties for New York’s Drivers
headline.print_headline: Stiff Penalties Are Sought to Eliminate Bad Driving
